metadata.title: CVE-2014-2338 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
IKEv2 in strongSwan 4.0.7 before 5.1.3 allows remote attackers to bypassauthentication by rekeying an IKE_SA during (1) initiation or (2)re-authentication, which triggers the IKE_SA state to be set toestablished.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-2338` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libstrongswan - 5.1.2-0ubuntu2
strongswan - 5.1.2-0ubuntu2
strongswan-ike - 5.1.2-0ubuntu2
strongswan-ikev1 - 5.1.2-0ubuntu2
strongswan-ikev2 - 5.1.2-0ubuntu2

criterions.comment: strongswan package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.1.2-0ubuntu2').
